entries.meaning: (literally, military) A destructive capacity that exceeds that needed to destroy an enemy; especially with nuclear weapons.
examples: [The] increase in nuclear missiles available to the West was operationally unnecessary and would only add to the existing nuclear overkill; mixed manning was a formula for military disaster;  […]

entries.meaning: (literally) Destruction beyond what is necessary to kill, especially in murder.
(by extension) An unnecessary excess of whatever is needed to achieve a goal.
examples: 24 hours of TV coverage of the US election verged on overkill.
Should I give you yet more homework, or would that be overkill?

entries.meaning: (manufacturing) An unnecessary excess of disposal because of too high criteria of inspection.

verbs.description: overkill (third-person singular simple present overkills, present participle overkilling, simple past and past participle overkilled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To destroy something with more (nuclear) force than is required.
(manufacturing) To dispose of too many items because of too-high criteria of inspection.
To do something excessive to achieve a goal.
